Video games, known as "action games", include high-intensity physical challenges and rapid-fire gameplay that test players' reflexes and ability to think on their feet. 
Combat, platforming, and puzzle-solving are common features in games of this kind. Players in action games often have access to a wide array of weapons and power-ups to kill foes and advance through stages. Grand Theft Auto, Assassin's Creed, and Call of Duty are just a few well-known titles that fall under this category.

Girls games aim to pique the interest of young women. The characters and plots of these games often centre on women. Girls' games aren't limited to only the role-playing genre. Barbie, My Little Pony, and Disney Princess are popular girls' games.

Stickman games were video games in which the players control stick figures. Fast-paced action games, such as platforming or puzzle-solving, is the main draw of these games, which typically include simplistic visuals. It's not uncommon for stick figures to appear in games that have shooting or combat. Games like Stickman Hook, Stickman Warriors, and Stickman Shooter are all great examples of the genre.

Video games in the Minecraft Games category are adaptations of the wildly successful sandbox game Minecraft. Open-world exploration, resource collection, and crafting are common gameplay elements these types of games share. It's not uncommon for Minecraft games to combine aspects of survival and adventure. Minecraft Dungeons, Minecraft Earth, and Minecraft Story Mode are all examples of well-liked Minecraft games.

Video games in which players take the role of a driver are sometimes referred to as "driving games." Typical titles in this genre include races where players may choose from various automobiles, trucks, and motorbikes. Other game types, such as simulation and open world, may be included in driving games. Popular titles in this genre include Gran Turismo, Need for Speed, and Forza Horizon.

The subgenre of driving games known as "Truck Games" focuses on, you guessed it, going and commanding trucks. These games put players in the role of a transporter, navigating hazardous locations while delivering goods. Other game types, including racing games and puzzles, may be included in truck games. Games like Euro Truck Simulator 2, American Tractor Simulator, and Truck Driver are great examples of this genre.

The subgenre of driving games known as "car games" centres on the operation of motor vehicles. Many games include races and pit players against one another or computer-controlled foes. Games revolving around automobiles may take various forms, including simulation and open world. Forza Motorsport, Gran Turismo, and Project Cars are just a few of the many games in this genre.

To put it simply, shooting games are those in which the player takes control of a character who fires guns at virtual foes. Combat is a common feature of these games, requiring rapid reflexes and pinpoint precision to prevail over adversaries. Other game types, such as first-person shooters and adventures, might fall under "shooting games." Call of Duty, Battlefield and Halo are just a few examples of successful first-person shooter video games.

Video games whereby characters engage in hand-to-hand combat are known as fighting games. These games often have strategic features and demand players master intricate move sets to win. Other game types, such as action and role-playing, may be included in fighting games. Mortal Kombat, Tekken, and Street Fighter are successful fighting games.

"Zombie games" are video games in which zombies are the main antagonists. In these games, players must employ various weapons and gadgets to survive against waves of zombies. Even non-shooter or non-adventure games may have zombies. Resident Evil and Left are two well-known examples of this subgenre of video games.

IO Games: IO games are browser-based, multiplayer, internet video games. These games offer live, one-on-one competition between players, often with simplistic visuals and gameplay mechanics. Any game, from racing to strategy to first-person shooters, may be made into an IO game. Agar.io, Slither.io, and Diep.io are all well-known IO games.

Video games developed in HTML5 may be played directly in a web browser without any extra plugins or applications. Puzzle, adventure, and platformer games are all fair for this category. The widespread availability and simplicity of creating HTML5 games have contributed to their meteoric popularity. Games like Cut the Rope, Angry Birds, and 2048, are all great examples of HTML5 games.

In a nutshell, action games are both challenging and exciting, including elements such as fighting and puzzle-solving. Games for female children tend to concentrate on topics like make-up, hairstyles, and fashion. The protagonists of these games are often stick figures, and the gameplay focuses on fast-paced action and platforming. Video games based on the popular sandbox game Minecraft often contain questing, looting, and building. Fun in the driving genre attempt to recreate the sensation of being behind the wheel, whereas games in the truck and automobile genres squarely emphasise the manipulation and control of such vehicles.

In shooting games, players fire guns at their opponents, whereas in fighting games, players engage in hand-to-hand combat. Zombies are the main antagonists of zombie games, which focus on survival and the use of weaponry to ward off hordes of the undead. Video games developed using HTML5 technology and playable in a web browser without the need for extra software fall into the same category as "online multiplayer games played in a browser" (also known as "IO games").
